Name: MPI_Comm_create
Description:
MPI_Comm_create allows MPI processes in a given communicator to create a communicator per group. In other words, for MPI processes that belong to a given communicator while residing in different groups, a call to MPI_Comm_create creates distinct communicators; one for each group. Note: the groups specified must be disjoint.
If an MPI process passes a group argument specifying a group it does not belong to, MPI_COMM_NULL is returned. For MPI processes that do not belong to a group, MPI_GROUP_EMPTY can be passed as the group argument.

Parameters.Name: old_communicator
Parameters.Description: The communicator from which the group of processes is extracted.

Parameters.Name: group
Parameters.Description: The group containing the processes from the old_communicator to include in the new communicator. It can contain the entire group of processes of the old communicator, or just a subgroup.

Parameters.Name: new_communicator
Parameters.Description: The variable in which store the communicator created. If the calling process is not part of the communicator created, MPI_COMM_NULL is stored instead.

Return.Description:
The error code returned from the communicator creation.
- MPI_SUCCESS: the routine successfully completed.
